title: Injection: SQLi Basic
description: Find the SQL injection vulnerability to bypass login.
hint: Try common SQL injection payloads in the username field.

title: Broken Auth: Session Hijack
description: Exploit a weak session management to hijack another user's session.
hint: Look for predictable session IDs or insecure cookie flags.

title: XSS: Stored XSS
description: Inject a persistent cross-site scripting payload.
hint: Consider areas where user input is displayed to others, like comments or profiles.

title: Insecure Design: Logic Flaw
description: Discover and exploit a flaw in the application's business logic.
hint: Think about how the application processes orders or grants privileges.

title: Security Misconfig: Default Creds
description: Find a service running with default credentials.
hint: Check common services and their default usernames/passwords.

title: Vulnerable Components: Outdated Lib
description: Identify and exploit a vulnerability in an outdated third-party library.
hint: Look for version numbers in HTTP headers or JavaScript files.

title: Ident & Auth Failures: 2FA Bypass
description: Bypass the Two-Factor Authentication mechanism.
hint: Consider race conditions or insecure API endpoints related to 2FA.

title: Software & Data Integrity: Insecure Deserialization
description: Exploit insecure deserialization to execute arbitrary code.
hint: Look for serialized objects passed between client and server.

title: Security Logging & Monitoring: Insufficient Logging
description: Perform an action without it being logged, indicating insufficient monitoring.
hint: Try to trigger errors or unusual behavior and see if they are recorded.

title: SSRF: Basic SSRF
description: Use Server-Side Request Forgery to access internal resources.
hint: Look for parameters that accept URLs or file paths.

title: Injection: Command Injection
description: Inject OS commands into the application.
hint: Think about features that interact with the underlying operating system.

title: Broken Auth: Password Reset Flaw
description: Exploit a flaw in the password reset functionality.
hint: Check for token validity, rate limiting, or direct user ID manipulation.

title: XSS: Reflected XSS
description: Inject a non-persistent cross-site scripting payload.
hint: Look for parameters that reflect user input directly into the page.

title: Insecure Design: IDOR
description: Exploit Insecure Direct Object References to access unauthorized data.
hint: Change numerical or predictable IDs in URLs or API requests.

title: Security Misconfig: Directory Listing
description: Find a publicly accessible directory listing.
hint: Try navigating to common directory names like /admin, /uploads, /backups.

title: Vulnerable Components: Dependency Confusion
description: Exploit a dependency confusion vulnerability.
hint: This is an advanced supply-chain attack. Research how it works.

title: Ident & Auth Failures: Brute Force
description: Brute force a weak login mechanism.
hint: Look for lack of rate limiting on login attempts.

title: Software & Data Integrity: File Upload Bypass
description: Bypass file upload restrictions to upload malicious files.
hint: Check for MIME type checks, extension filtering, and content validation.

title: Security Logging & Monitoring: Alert Fatigue
description: Overwhelm the logging system to hide malicious activity.
hint: Generate a large volume of benign events to obscure a malicious one.

title: SSRF: Blind SSRF
description: Exploit a blind SSRF vulnerability.
hint: This requires out-of-band techniques to confirm the vulnerability.
